body.p: Based upon the functional groups contained in the core structure common to all amino acids, which of the following statements is true regarding amino acids?

multiple_choice.choice: They will form glycosidic bonds with other amino acids.
The first two choices are both true.
All of the above are true.

feedback.p: Incorrect. It is true that the carboxyl group will act as an acid (carboxylic acid), this is not the only correct choice.

Incorrect. It is true that the amino group will act as a base (it absorbs a hydrogen ion, giving the nitrogen atom the positive charge shown in the amino group, but that is not the only correct answer here.
Incorrect. Glycosidic bonds are found between glucose molecules, peptide bonds form between amino acids.
Correct. The amino group acts as a basic group and the carboxyl group acts as an acidic group.
Incorrect. At least one of the above is not true.

hint.p: Look carefully at the structure of the alpha amino acid.
